title: The Food Project's Local Food Guide
name: The Food Project's Local Food Guide
description:
A Map by Mpless

This map shows the locations of farms close to Boston, MA in Middlesex, Norfolk and Suffolk Counties.

properties.name: Allandale Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless259 Allandale Rd, Chestnut Hill, MA

properties.name: Applefield Farms
properties.description: Posted by Mpless722 Great Road, Stow, MA 01775Steven, Kirsten and Raymond Mong 722 Great Road, Stow, MA 01775 978-897-9308 Farmstand: April-Nov., 9am-7pm (closed Wed., July-Nov.) Beef*, pork*, chicken*, eggs*, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (raspberries, melons)*

properties.name: Arena Farms
properties.description: Posted by MplessRoute 2 and Fairhaven Rd, Concord, MA, 01742978-369-4769 Farmstand: Year round, daily, 9am-7pm Turkey*, milk*, cheese*, ice cream *, eggs*, syrup*, honey*, baked goods*, jams*, herbs (42 varieties)*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit* Growing since 1920 on over 200 acres of farmland in Concord, Lincoln, Wayland, & Sudbury. Bedding plants, herbs, perennials, and fresh-picked greenhouse tomatoes are available beginning in May. We offer over 350 varieties of vegetables and fruits.Come see New England’s largest pumpkin piles! Public Events: Tomato Festival - TBA; Corn Fest - July 16-17; Fall Petting Zoo

Honey*, herbs*, vegetables*, fruits (raspberries, blackberries, plums, peaches, pears, apples, table grapes)* Public Events: Blossoms & Bluebirds Open House - May 7-8

Public Events: Edible Wild Plant Walk with Russ Cohen.

properties.description: Posted by Mpless1276 Broadway Rd. Dracut, MA 01826David Dumaresq 1276 Broadway Rd. (Rt 113), Dracut, MA 01826 978-454-3434 Farmstand: May 1–Nov.1, daily, 9am-6pm U-Pick: seasonal Milk*, syrup, honey*, baked goods, jams*, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, peaches, pears, 9 varieties of apples)* We grow a wide range of fresh fruits and vegetables on our 50 acre farm.

properties.name: Busa Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless52 Lowell Street, Lexington, MAFrancis Busa 52 Lowell Street, Lexington, MA 02420 781-860-0253 Farmstand: Year round, daily, 9am-6:30pm CSA: June–Oct., Sat., 11am-2pm (CSA coupons can be used at farmstand April-Oct.) Herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*

properties.name: Butter Brook Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless982 Main Street, Acton, MAGuy McKay 982 Main Street, Acton, MA 01720 978-263-1936 Farmstand: Year round, Mon.-Fri., 9am-6pm; Sat., 9am-5pm; Sun., 11am-5pm Beef *, pork, chicken*, turkey*, milk, cheese, ice cream, eggs*, syrup*, honey*, baked goods, jams, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit(apples, blackberry, blueberry, rhubarb, strawberry)* We are dedicated to growing certified organic fruit, vegetables and plants. We are a four- season grower, and we grow over 45 different small fruits and vegetables. Every product that we carry is environmentally safe, earth friendly and bursting with flavorful nutrition the way nature intended. Our mission is to help maintain the short and long term social, economic and ecological needs of ourselves and our local community.

properties.name: Carver Hill Orchards
properties.description: Posted by MplessWilliam C. Lord and Cynthia Lord Box Mill Road, Stow 01775 978-897-6117 Farmstand: June 15–Dec. 24, daily, 10am-5pm U-Pick: Sept. 1-Oct.15, daily, 10am-5pm Cheese*, ice cream*, eggs*, syrup, honey*, baked goods*, jams, vegetable*, fruit (apples, peaches, plums, nectarines, raspberries, sweet cherries, blueberries )* A family farm for over 100 years, we grow fruits and veggies in season. We also have a gift department, ice cream, jams and jellies, apple cider made at the farm. We are available for outings, birthdays, etc.

properties.name: Chip-In Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless201 Hartwell Rd., Bedford, MAPaul and Neil Couvee 201 Hartwell Rd., Bedford, MA 01730 781-275-2545 Farmstand: Year round, daily, 10am-6pm Chicken, milk*, ice cream*, eggs*, honey*, baked goods*, vegetables*, fruit* Our farmstand sells our own fruits and vegetables when in season along with our own fresh eggs from free-running hens. We also carry milk, bread, ice cream, frozen entrees, chicken, and a wide selection of grocery items. Come visit our free petting zoo, and get Christmas trees, bedding plants, and pumpkins from the farm!

properties.name: Codman Community Farms
properties.description: Posted by MplessRay and Harriette Adamson Corner of Codman Rd. & Lincoln Rd., Lincoln, MA 01773 781-259-0456 General Store: Year round, daily, 9am-6pm (eggs, meat, hay)* Farmstand: mid June-Oct., Sat., 9am-2pm, (produce) U-Pick: May-Sept., daily, 9am-6pm (flowers) Beef*, pork*, lamb*, turkey*, eggs*, honey*, flowers*, vegetables* Historic Codman Community Farm is a working farm. We welcome visitors to our store, farmer\'s market and events. We have hens to zucchini! Visit our barns and animals. Admission . Public Events: Winter Carnival – Jan 29; Sheep Shearing - April 15; Gala Auction – May 6; Teddy Bear Tea - May 13; Open House at the Codman Gardens - June 11; Harvest Fair - Sept. 16

U-Pick: mid June-Fall (strawberries, raspberries) Beef*, pork*, lamb*, goat*, eggs*, syrup*, wool/yarn*, lamb and goat skins*, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries)* Without using chemical pesticides or fertilizers, Drumlin Farm grows all the produce varieties you can find in the grocery store, only here they\'re available in season. Yarn, lamb skins and eggs are available all year, meat is available in fall and spring.

We grow on a 230-acre farm in Groton. We are building a new farmstand that will have agricultural antiques, dried flowers and take-out food.

Call for conditions. Open same times as farmstand. Honey*, pies, cider, herbs*, flowers*,vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries)* Scenes for the movie “Spartan” with Val Kilmer were shot here! Public Events: Corn maze 9-6pm July - Nov, concerts, haunted hayride evenings in Oct, Christmas hayride weekends in Dec.

properties.name: Hill Orchard
properties.description: Posted by Mpless2 Hunt Road, Westford, MA 01886Anthony Levick (manager) for Westford Conservation Commission 2 Hunt Road, Westford, MA 01886 978-692-9894 (farmstand) 603-242-6417 (office) Farmstand: Aug. 4-Thanksgiving, Wed.-Sun., 10am-5pm U-Pick: 2nd weekend of Sept-Nov 1, Wed.-Sun. & Columbus Day, 10am-5pm Milk, syrup, honey, jam, cider, bread, flowers, pumpkins, fruit (apricots, plums, nectarines, peaches, pears, 25 varieties of apples, raspberries, and blueberries)* We grow apricots, plums, nectarines, peaches pears, and apples on 20 acres. Pick-your-own apples with free wagon ride on weekends. Peaches are picked ripe and sold in the farmstand. Hill Orchard is owned by the town of Westford.

properties.name: Hillbrook Orchards
properties.description: Posted by Mpless141 Old Ayer Road, Groton, MA 01450141 Old Ayer Road, Groton, MA 01450 978-448-6638 Farmstand: in fall, 10am-5pm, call ahead for dates We have plants and apples for sale.

properties.name: Honey Pot Hill Orchards
properties.description: Posted by Mpless144 Sudbury Road, Stow, MA 01775Julie Martin-Sullivan and Andrew Martin 144 Sudbury Road, Stow, MA 01775 978-562-5666 Farmstand: late July-Christmas, daily, 9am-6pm U-Pick: late July-late Oct., daily, 10am-5pm (blueberries, apples and pears in season) Baked goods*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (blueberries, peaches, plums, 25 varieties of apples, pears)* We are a 3rd-generation family farm that focuses on creating a fun, family experience at our 200-acre farm. You can pick the great fruits we grow, visit with our farm animals, or find your way through our hedge and tunnel maze. In the fall we offer hayrides. We have fresh pressed ciders, thousands of pumpkins, tomatoes, squash, sunflowers, mums, cider donuts, caramel apples and more. Public Events: Hayrides – weekends, early Sept.-late Oct., 10am-5pm, weekdays, mid Sept.-mid Oct., 12-4pm; Hedge and Tunnel Maze - May-Nov., daily, 9am-5pm

We farm 16 acres and have some animals. It is a family farm that has been operating over 100 years.

properties.name: Land’s Sake Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless86 Wellesley St., Weston, MA 02493Mike Raymond 86 Wellesley St., Weston, MA 02493 781-893-1162 Farmstand: May 1-Oct. 31, daily, 10am-6pm U-Pick: May 1-Oct. 31, daily, 10am-6pm CSA: May 1-Oct. 31 syrup*, honey*, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries)* Land\'s Sake is a non-profit organization demonstrating sustainable land management and environmental education. We also do ecological landscaping and tree work, institutional landscape management, trail maintenance, sustainable silviculture, and interpretive tours of the farm and forest. Public events: Sugaring off - last Sat of March; Strawberry Festival - June 24; Pumpkin Festival - Oct 21

properties.name: Lawndale Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless91 Frost Road, Tyngsboro, MA 01879Doug and Ken Times 91 Frost Road, Tyngsboro, MA 01879 978-649-7629 Farmstand: July 20-Dec. 22, 10 am-7pm, call for days U-Pick: Aug. 15-Oct. 15, 10am-5pm, call for days Honey*, jams, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit We grow a large variety of vegetables. We sell our own hay and straw as well as trees, wreaths, roping and decorations for Christmas. Customers may roam the spacious fields or walk to the trails in the adjoining town conservation land. Public Events: Hayride to pumpkin field to pick your own - Sept. 15-Oct. 16

properties.name: Lindentree Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless10 Old Concord Rd., Lincoln, MA 01773Arthur Kurtz 10 Old Concord Rd., Lincoln, MA 01773 781-259-1259 CSA: June-Oct. U-Pick: for CSA members only, June-Oct. Herbs*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries)*

properties.name: Lookout Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless89 Pleasant St., Natick, MA 01760 Holly Hamel 89 Pleasant St., Natick, MA 01760 508-651-1539, 508-653-0653 (U-Pick hotline) Farmstand: Year round, daily, 8am-8pm, Winter 8am-7pm U-Pick: Aug.-Nov. daily, 10am-5pm (apples, peaches, strawberries, raspberries) Honey*, baked goods, cider*, herbs*, vegetables*, fruit (apples, peaches, strawberries, raspberries, pears, Asian pear)* Located just off Rt. 16 in South Natick, Lookout Farm, established in 1680, is one of America\'s oldest working farms. Certified organic by the Organic Grower and Buyers Assoc., the farm operates with respect for the environment through innovative approaches to agriculture. The farm is dedicated to promoting the benefits of organic farming including health and nutrition. Public Events: petting zoo, school group tours, birthday parties, U-Pick trains take visitors out to the orchards to pick. No visit is complete without trying our authentic Italian gelato!

properties.name: Lupien’s Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless240 Westford St., Chelmsford, MAMaria Lupien 240 Westford St., Chelmsford, MA 01824 978-256-0654 Farmstand: weekends, Sept.-Dec.23, call for times Fruit (apples)* We are a small apple farm that is open on weekends in the fall.

properties.name: MacArthur Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless137 Concord St., Holliston, MA 01746Peter and Helen MacArthur 137 Concord St., Holliston, MA 01746 508-429-4873 Farmstand: April 1-Dec. 24, Mon.-Sat., 8:30am-7pm; Sun., 8:30am-6pm Herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit* We are a family farm. We grow bedding plants, hanging plants, vegetable plants, perennials, and mums in our greenhouses. We also grow greenhouse tomatoes in spring. We farm an 18- acre vegetable field at another location in Holliston. Last year we won the Mass Tomato contest and also the readers’ choice award for the best garden center in Holliston.

properties.name: Mainstone Farm

We raise vegetables sustainably that we direct market at our farmstand.

properties.name: McGrath Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless449 Barretts Mill Rd, Concord, MA Patrick McGrath 449 Barretts Mill Rd, Concord, MA 01742 978-369-2980 Farmstand Open: early May-Nov.1, daily, 10am-6pm Herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, black and red raspberries, blueberries)* We have fall raspberries through to fall freeze! Asparagus, fruits, sweet corn, pumpkins, gourds and ornamentals are our big crops.

You can order up to half a cow or less. Our farm is open to public. We encourage visitors to visit us and the cows.

properties.name: Parlee Farms
properties.description: Posted by Mpless95 Farwell Road, Tyngsboro, MA 01879Mark and Ellen Parlee 95 Farwell Road, Tyngsboro, MA 01879 978-649-3854 Farmstand: June-Oct., hours vary - please call or check website for info U-Pick: June–Oct., hours vary - please call or check website for info (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, flowers, apples, pumpkins) Milk*, ice cream*, honey*, baked goods*, jams*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, apples)* Parlee Farms is a 93-acre pick-your-own farm with a 7500 sq. ft. post and beam farmstand. We offer ice cream and fresh fruit desserts through Mary\'s Country Kitchen. Annie\'s Animal Barns house young farm animals for our customers to visit with and feed. We practice Integrated Pest Management (IPM) on all of our crops.

properties.description: Posted by Mpless135 Pine Hill Rd, Chelmsford, MA 01824Henry Parlee 135 Pine Hill Rd, Chelmsford, MA 01824 978-256-2859 U-Pick: Strawberries - June, daily, 7am-7pm; Blueberries – July, Sat.&Sun., 8am-2pm or by appointment; Pumpkins and Maze – Sept.-Oct., Sat.&Sun., 11am-5pm Vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, blueberries )* We have had U-Pick strawberries for over 50 years.

properties.description: Posted by Mpless195 New Boston Rd., Dracut, MA 01826 195 New Boston Rd., Dracut, MA 01826 978-957-0031 Farmstand: Year round, daily, 8am-8pm Home delivery: Dracut, Lowell, Tewksbury, Chelmsford, Westford and Methuen Milk*, ice cream* Shaw Farm is a family owned and operated dairy that has produced and packaged its own milk and ice cream since 1908. Milk is sold in glass bottles. We distribute through our farm store, home delivery and wholesale to other farm outlets. Our cows are not given artificial growth hormones.

properties.description: Posted by Mpless106 West Acton Road, Stow, MA 01775Ted Painter 106 West Acton Road, Stow, MA 01775 978-897-9287 Farmstand: Sept.-Nov., daily, 9am-6pm U-Pick: Sept.-Nov., daily, 9am-6pm Syrup*, honey*, baked goods*, jams, pumpkins*,fruit (apples, peaches)* Public Events: cider pressing, pony rides, hayrides, & moonbounce every weekend in fall.

properties.name: Spence Hill Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless39 Coolidge Street, Sherborn, MABob Spence 39 Coolidge Street, Sherborn, MA 01770 508-653-8939 U-Pick: pumpkins on fall weekends - call ahead for hours Flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, raspberries)*

properties.name: Spencer Brook Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless77 Westford Rd, Concord, MA 01742Ben Wilson 77 Westford Rd, Concord, MA 01742 978-371-6404 CSA: Mid June-Oct., Pickup on Wed. and Sat., delivery within 10 miles Lamb (call for availability), duck eggs, honey*, herbs*, vegetables* We are a new farm this year! We are also offering wool.

properties.name: Stearns Farm CSA
properties.description: Posted by Mpless862 Edmands Road, Framingham, MAKathy Huckins 862 Edmands Road, Framingham, MA 01701 508-371-4310 CSA: June 14-Oct. 28, Tues. & Fri., 2pm-7pm U-Pick: flowers: mid June-mid Oct., self serve during daylight hours Honey*, baked goods*, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)* Stearns Farm, founded in 1954, has always been farmed organically. We have a children\'s garden and Penelope\'s Herb Garden. It is a beautiful spot to come and rest and reconnect with nature and agriculture. The 10 acres of farmland and the 70 acres that adjoin Callahan State Park were given to Sudbury Valley Trustees (SVT) in 1975. In 1991, the Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) model of farming was introduced and in 1994 Stearns Organic Farm, CSA incorporated as a non-profit. Public Events: We hold events for CSA shareholders and classes (composting).

properties.name: Stonefield Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless91 Martin Street, Acton, MA 0172091 Martin Street, Acton, MA 01720 978-263-5572 Farmstand: flowers all year, food in fall (til end of Oct.), weekdays, 9am - 6pm; Sat., 9am-5pm; Sun., closed July 16-Aug. 15 Herbs*(sold as plants), flowers*, vegetables*

properties.name: Sullo Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless70 Kendrick Rd., Wakefield, MA 01880 David Sullo 70 Kendrick Rd., Wakefield, MA 01880 781-245-0016 Farmstand: June-Sept., 8:30am - 5pm, call first Pork* (see below), herbs*, vegetables* Pork is by request. I will raise a piglet to market size and have it processed and packaged to your specifications. Meat is flash frozen after packaging, and you must buy the whole pig. Orders must be placed by March 15th. Pick up at farm or arrange for delivery.

properties.name: Sunshine Farm
properties.description: Posted by Mpless41 Kendall Ave., Sherborn, MA 01770Jim Geoghegan 41 Kendall Ave., Sherborn, MA 01770 508-655-5022 Farmstand: May-Dec., daily, 9am-6pm U-Pick: strawberries - June, daily, 9am-6pm; pumpkins – Oct. Cheese*, ice cream*, eggs*, honey*, baked goods*, jams, herbs*, flowers*, vegetables*, fruit (strawberries, peaches)* We have a new farmstand and ice cream store open in 2004, with 50 acres of vegetables and fruit in season. Bedding plants are available in May and June. Our farmstand bakery carries pies, cookies and breads. Public Events: Strawberry festival - June; Corn Boil - Aug.; Sherborn Open Farm Day - Sept.

We have a full deli, and sell plants. Public Events: On site activities (company outings, birthday parties); monthly family festivals June-October
